<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Frequently Asked Questions</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Frequently Asked Questions</h1>


<h3 class="heading">A Before I decide to apply</h3>




<p class="p"> <strong>1. What
‘A’ levels (and equivalent qualifications) do we seek?</strong></p>
<p class="p">We don’t have a fixed policy. Applicants who have taken a ‘science’
element at ‘A’ level or equivalent make strong candidates for our HAMS
programme. Many of our successful applicants doing ‘A’ levels study some form
of the following: Art &amp; Design; English Literature, History of Art,
History, a modern language, Government, Politics or Sociology, Maths, and a
long tail of other subjects including Chemistry, Physics, Biology, and
Religious Studies. If you are seriously interested in our subject, the fact
that you have not done either Art &amp; Design or History of Art at 18+ is no
sort of barrier to us taking your application seriously. However, we do look
for evidence that you have completed at least one and preferably two
essay-based subjects (which include, but are not limited to, English, History, History of Art, Philosophy,
Sociology, Classics, Economics, Theology, Languages, Politics, Religious
Studies, Anthropology, Archaeology, Film Studies, Media Studies, Critical and
Contextual Studies, Cultural Studies, and Law). At degree level History of
Art is a subject in which students have to read both extensively and
intensively in texts that are rich in information and often demanding in their
theoretical complexity; so we are interested in evidence that you can meet such
demands.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>2. What is the
HoA Modern Foreign Language requirement?</strong> </p>
<p class="p"> The Department looks favourably at candidates<strong> </strong>who have a B-grade or equivalent in a Modern Foreign
language at GCSE or similar 16+ level: this is a higher requirement than
the standard UCL requirement of a C-grade. This is because the Department
is committed to the idea that our students should be able to access
relevant sources and discussions in languages other than English, recognising
that relevant discussions, like relevant works of art, come from a wide range
of language-areas and geographies. However, we will be flexible if an
individual has made an otherwise excellent application, and might not have had
the opportunities to pursue a language at school.  UCL’s main admissions
web-site discusses the University’s policy in respect to applicants who were
prevented (e.g. by the offer at their school), from taking a Modern Foreign
Language:</p>
<p class="p"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/apply/entry-requirements" target="_self">http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/apply/entry-requirements </a><br /></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>3. What do we look for in the school reference?</strong></p>
<p class="p">We like school references which are as specific as possible about your
academic strengths and which give us a clear picture of you as a person. The
reference is also helpful in providing contextual information about an
application, e.g. an explanation if exam performance has been inconsistent. If
you are doing a Foundation course, a current tutor might also be a suitable
referee.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>4. What do we look for in the personal statement? </strong></p>
<p class="p">Your main objective in writing the statement should be to give the
admissions officers a clear impression of what you are like, how you think, and
why you want to study History of Art. Write in a vigorous, direct style. Don’t
try to be overly clever, but be confident, clear and honest. Make sure the
statement is well written and grammatically correct. History of Art is a
text-heavy discipline, so evidence of reading in or around the subject is a
plus. An interest in viewing art is also considered positively, although no
priority is given to students who have travelled extensively to do so over
those whose experience of art is closer to home. This is the only part of the
form over which you have complete control, so it is important to use it well.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>5.  I
want to take a gap year: can I apply for a deferred entry place? </strong></p>
<p class="p">   Yes, certainly. We consider deferred entry
applications without prejudice.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>6.  Can
mature students apply?</strong></p>
<p class="p">   Yes.  A student is considered mature
when they are over 21 at the point of entry. Rather than asking for specific
qualifications, we ask mature students for evidence of recent, successful
study. This is usually in the form of an Access course which should be taken at
an OCN (Open College Network approved) institute of Further
  Education.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>7.  Do
you accept transfers from other Universities? </strong></p>
<p class="p"> The UCL History of Art
undergraduate single honours degree programmes are not currently
accepting transfers from other departments.<strong><br /></strong></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>8.  Can
I study History of Art as a part time student?</strong> The department does not admit students who
wish to study part-time. </p>
<p class="p"> <strong>9.  How
many students do you accept each year?</strong></p>
<p class="p"> About 68 in total,
including both UK/EU students and Overseas students, plus another 20–25 doing
combined honours programmes of various sorts.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>10.  Can
I visit the History of Art department?</strong></p>
<p class="p"> UCL is an open campus.
Anyone can wander round its public areas; and you should feel free to do so.
The Department of History of Art does not normally arrange visits or
consultations for individuals who want to look at the department, however
if we make you an offer we will invite you to attend an  'Offer
Holder Open Day' at the Department. This will give you an opportunity
to ask more detailed questions in person about the degree, to meet the Faculty
and learn more about the degree programme and our approach to teaching.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>11.  Do you have Open Days?</strong></p>
<p class="p">UCL has <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/access-ucl/open-days" target="_self">Open
Days</a> in late June or early July
and early September. The University of London has an Open
Day in mid-September. On all of
these days the admissions tutor is normally present to introduce the department
and/or answer your queries. As stated above, if we make you an offer
this will include an invitation to an 'Offer Holder Open Day' in
the Department. This will give you an opportunity to ask more
detailed questions in person about the degree, to meet other members of staff,
and to learn more about the degree programme and our approach to
teaching.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong> </strong></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>12.  Can I spend
time at an overseas University as part of my degree?</strong></p>
<p class="p">   The structure of our three-year degrees V350 and V3F2 make it impossible
to take time away from UCL. Students who
wish to spend a year abroad while studying history of art should apply through
the ‘Modern Languages Plus’ programme (RY00)</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>13. Do we accept
Late Applications? </strong></p>
<p class="p">  The answer to that may depend on your fee status. We may 
indeed close the course to late applications for students whose 
admission is covered by the UK/EU quota system, while keeping it open 
for others. Practice is flexible, and varies from year to year: 
up-to-date information is available via UCAS.</p>


<h3 class="heading"> B About my application</h3>




<p class="p"> <strong>14. Do
you hold interviews?</strong></p>
<p class="p"> No. This is no longer
possible given the vast number of applications we receive. If we are
considering making you an offer - based on your UCAS application
- you will be contacted via email and asked to complete a short written
exercise and piece of visual analysis. These exercises will be
carefully assessed in terms of displaying evidence of intellectual
curiosity, analytical and critical thinking and a lively engagement
with visual and material culture. If successful you will
then be invited to an 'Offer Holder Open Day' at the Department.
This will give you an opportunity to ask more detailed questions in
person about the degree, to meet the Faculty and learn more about the
degree programme and our approach to teaching.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong> </strong></p>
<p class="p"> <strong>15. Do I have to
attend the open day if invited? </strong></p>
<p class="p"> Ideally yes, if you live in
the UK, unless there are
individual circumstances that make it impossible. The 'Offer
Holder Open Day'  will provide an opportunity to meet with teaching
staff, experience seminar-style teaching in the department; talk to
current undergraduates and to fellow candidates, and will include a tour of
UCL. It is a good chance for you to interview us, as well as vice-versa. We
appreciate that for some students the cost and trouble of getting to UCL
would be very difficult or prohibitively expensive. All students in such
circumstances should contact us in advance. We also stress that this day
is designed for you - the offer holder - not your parents. So you should not
bring along any guests. However, if your parents want to accompany you to
London they are welcome to attend a drop in Q&amp;A session tailored
specifically for them on the day. If so they are welcome to contact
the department for more details.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>16. How do we
communicate with applicants? </strong>All communication will be by email or direct through UCAS.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>17. When can I expect to receive a
decision on my application?</strong></p>
<p class="p">   Candidates who apply by the UCAS January
deadline can expect to receive a decision via UCAS by the dates given in the
UCAS guides for applicants. Late applicants can expect to receive a decision by
mid to late July. </p>


<h3 class="heading"> C Life at UCL and your degree programme</h3>




<p class="p"> <strong>18. How can I find out about
accommodation and other aspects of student life?</strong></p>
<p class="p">   For queries about studying at UCL which are
not related to your academic life in the History of Art Department, you should
consult the UCL prospective student pages of our website for the contact
details of the relevant departments e.g. Accommodation.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>19. How will I be assessed?</strong></p>
<p class="p">   By a combination of (written) examination
and coursework. All courses are assessed during and at the end of each academic
year, not just at the end of your degree. You can find out more by exploring
the ‘current students’ sections of the website.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>20. How many teaching hours are there a
week?</strong></p>
<p class="p">  This varies according to the course units you are taking. 
An average week may probably provide 8-10 contact hours. You are 
expected to spend +/-30 hours a week studying, in addition to time spent
 in lectures and seminars. Students usually spend of lot of their time 
studying in the UCL library and the nearby Senate House and British 
Library, as well as doing close looking in London’s museums and 
galleries. In addition, all academic staff and personal tutors have 
regular office hours, which you are encouraged to attend.</p>
<p class="p"> <strong>21. How can I find out more about the degree programmes?</strong></p>
<p class="p">  Browse through the History of Art <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/current-students" target="_self">current students</a> web-pages, and for an official and technical description, look via <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/academic-services/qme/ucl-prog-specs/shs-prog-specs" target="_self">http://www.ucl.ac.uk/academic-services/qme/ucl-prog-specs/shs-prog-specs </a>at the ‘programme specifications’ for History of Art Single Honours’
and for the History of art with Material Studies’ degrees.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>
 

</div>


<p class="clearfix">

   Undergraduate Open Days

 </a>
</p>

(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">History of Art Combined Honours</h1>
<div>
<a id="philosophy" name="philosophy"></a>


</div>



<div>

<section class="content-box philosophy-hoa-ba">
  
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">This degree aims to provide you with an understanding of a range of central philosophical debates together with a detailed education in history of art. All major areas of philosophy are available for study. You will also address issues about the very nature of art and human perception of visual culture.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>
<p class="p"><strong>Applications for the Philosophy and History of Art combined honours programme are made via the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy" target="_self">UCL Department of Philosophy</a></strong> <br /></p>
<hr class="rule" />






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Key Facts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i> 
  
<!-- Subtemplate: 2 columns with 50/50 division -->  
<section class="middle-split"> 

  <section class="middle-split__column1"> 
    



<h4 class="heading">Degree Programme</h4>



<p class="p">Philosophy and History of Art BA </p>



<h4 class="heading">UCAS Code</h4>



<p class="p">VV53</p>



<h4 class="heading">Duration</h4>



<p class="p">3 years</p>



<h4 class="heading">Application Deadline</h4>



<p class="p">15 January 2016</p>



<h4 class="heading">Subject area</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/philosophy" target="_self">Philosophy</a> and <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/history-art" target="_self">History of Art</a></p>


  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2"> 
    



<h4 class="heading">Faculty overview:</h4>



<p class="p"> <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah" target="_self">
          Faculty of Arts and Humanities 
    </a> </p>



<h4 class="heading">Department website:</h4>



<p class="p"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy">Philosophy</a> </p>



<h4 class="heading">Total intake (by subject area)</h4>



<p class="p">65
                                                (2016 entry)
                                            </p>



<h4 class="heading">Applications per place (by subject area)</h4>



<p class="p">12
                                                (2014 entry)
                                            </p>



<h4 class="heading">Research Excellence Framework</h4>



<p class="p">75% rated 4* (‘world-leading’) or 3* (‘internationally excellent’)</p>
<p class="p">What is the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework?</a></p>

 
      <!-- right content block --> 
  </section> 
</section>



</section>

</div>


</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry and Application</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Entry and Application</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAA</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>No specific subjects.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>38</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A total of 18 points in three higher level subjects, with no score below 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-ubaphiahar09">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-ubaphiahar09">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-ubaphiahar09">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-ubaphiahar09">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-ubaphiahar09">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-ubaphiahar09">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-btec-ubaphiahar09">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-accessCourse-ubaphiahar09">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with a minimum of 23 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-preU-ubaphiahar09">D3,D3,D3 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-ubaphiahar09">A,A,A at Advanced Highers (or A,A at Advanced Higher and A,A,A at Higher) </p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubaphiahar09"
    id="info-welshBacc-ubaphiahar09">Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAA. </p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                        <h4>International applications</h4>
                                        <p>In addition to A level and International Baccalaureate, UCL considers a wide range of international qualifications for entry to its undergraduate degree programmes.</p>
                                        <div class="dropdown">
                                            <input
    type="hidden" name="route" id="route-ubaphiahar09"
    value="UBAPHIAHAR09" class="route" />

                                        </div>
                                        <div class="box box--copy">
                                            <p
    class="equiv-content equiv-content-ubaphiahar09"></p>
                                        </div>
                                    
                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In addition to looking for outstanding grades in your academic record, we also assess your application for evidence of your ability to engage with philosophical arguments, your skills in reasoning and your interest in history of art.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ba-ch'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>Selection will be made on the basis of information contained in the UCAS application: achieved and predicted academic grades, the level of interest in, motivation towards, and experience of the subject as indicated in the personal statement, the reference supplied, and any relevant contextual factors.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>In addition applicants may be asked from time to time to provide further information, such as AS module results, or a response to a questionnaire.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Summary</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Degree Summary</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL Philosophy was one of the top-rated departments in the UK in the most recent (2014) Research Excellence Framework. The research interests of the academic staff are wide-ranging, covering all the main areas of philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL History of Art academic staff include specialists on all periods from the early Renaissance onwards, with particular strength in the study of contemporary art and two experts in the technical analysis of paintings.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>A rich array of extracurricular philosophy events is available in London. As a UCL philosophy student you will be able to attend the meetings of the Royal Institute of Philosophy, the Aristotelian Society and the University of London's Institute of Philosophy.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL's central location in London is within walking distance of the British Museum and provides easy access to the National Gallery, the Tate Galleries and the Victoria and Albert Museum.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: Philosophy.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>75% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Degree Structure</h1>
<p class="p">In each year of your degree you will take a number of individual 
courses, normally valued at 0.5 or 1.0 credits, adding up to a total of 
4.0 credits for the year. Courses are assessed in the academic year in 
which they are taken. The balance of compulsory and optional courses 
varies from programme to programme and year to year. A 1.0 credit is 
considered equivalent to 15 credits in the European Credit Transfer 
System (ECTS).</p>
<p class="p">Further details on department website: 
       <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate">
        Philosophy and History of Art BA      </a></p>
<script>
                require(['app/tabs']);
            </script>
<div class="tabs">
    <nav role="navigation" class="tabs__navigation"><ul>
  
   

    



        
            <li>

<a class="active" href="#tab-1">Year 1</a>


</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-2">Year 2</a>

</li>
        
    
    



        
            <li>


<a href="#tab-3">Year 3</a>

</li>
        
    
    </ul></nav>
<div class="tabs__group">
    
        
            
<div class="tabs__item tab active" id="tab-1">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Year 1</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Compulsory courses</h4>




<p class="p">History of Art and its Objects<br />History of European Art (1): Classical to Early Renaissance<br />History of European Art (2): High Renaissance to Present Day</p>


<h4 class="heading">Optional courses</h4>




<p class="p">You will select 2.0 credits from the following:<br /><br />Introduction to the History of Philosophy I<br />Introduction to the History of Philosophy II<br />Introduction to Logic I<br />Introduction to Logic II<br />Introduction to Moral Philosophy<br />Introduction to Political Philosophy<br />Knowledge and Reality<br />Philosophy Tutorial: Texts and Debate</p>

</div>
</div>




        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-2">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Year 2</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Compulsory courses</h4>




<p class="p">Gateway I<br />Gateway II</p>


<h4 class="heading">Optional courses</h4>




<p class="p">You will select 3.0 credits of options from a selection of History of Art courses.<br />And four optional courses from Philosophy, including courses from at least two of the groups A, B, and C:<br /><br />
Group A<br />Theoretical Philosophy (e.g. Knowledge; Metaphysics; Mind and Body; Language)<br /><br />Group B<br />Normative
 Philosophy (e.g. Aesthetics; Applied Ethics; Global Justice and Health;
 Morality and Literature; Normative Ethics; Political Philosophy)<br /><br />
Group C<br />History of Philosophy (e.g. Adorno: Art and Politics; Aristotle; Kant; Marxism; Plato)</p>

</div>
</div>


        

    
    
        



<div class="tabs__item tab" id="tab-3">
<div class="tab__content"><h2 class="heading">Year 3</h2>


<h4 class="heading">Compulsory courses</h4>




<p class="p">All third-year courses are optional.</p>


<h4 class="heading">Optional courses</h4>




<p class="p">You will choose four History of Art courses (to 
the value of 2.0 credits) from the wide range of options.You will also 
select four philosophy courses (to the value of 2.0 credits) from the 
wide range in year two.You can take 1.0 credits from other UCL 
departments in years two and three.<br /><br />You must pass at least six level III courses and have passed one course from group A, B, and C respectively to graduate.</p>
<p class="p"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"></a> </p>

</div>
</div>


        

    

</div>

</div>

<p class="p"><br /><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/philosophy/prospective-students/undergraduate"></a></p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Careers</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>This programme will assist you in constructing and assessing philosophical positions and arguments, thereby teaching you how to analyse and present complex ideas. Furthermore, it will provide you with an understanding of a wide range of traditional and contemporary philosophical theories. Such skills are transferable to non-philosophical contexts.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>The discipline of philosophical training, and in particular its emphasis on rigorous argumentation, logic, and clarity of thought and expression, makes philosophy graduates highly suitable for a wide variety of careers.</p></p>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p><p>Many recent UCL graduates have excelled in the legal profession, training as both solicitors and barristers, while others have entered publishing, journalism, finance, the civil service, Parliament, or local government. Philosophy graduates are also sought after as programmers and systems analysts. A high proportion of students go on to further study in philosophy.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>First career destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) of this programme include:</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>Graduate Trainee, Sotheby's</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, Graduate Diploma in Law at BPP University</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Trainee ABA Tutor, Ambitious About Autism</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>

                        <h2>Philosophy and History of Art BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="fees-and-funding">

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                
                                    <h4>Fees</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>UK/EU students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;9,250 (2018/19)</dd>
                                        <dt>Overseas students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;19,390 (2018/19)</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <p>Full details of UCL's tuition fees, tuition fee policy and potential increases to fees can be found on the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fee-schedules-2018-2019-undergraduate">UCL Students website</a>.</p>

                                    <h4>Funding</h4>
                                    <p>Various funding options are available, including student loans, scholarships and bursaries. UK students whose household income falls below a certain level may also be eligible for a non-repayable bursary or for certain scholarships. Please see the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/fees-funding">Fees and funding</a> pages for more details.</p>
                                    

                                    
                    
                                    <h4>Departmental scholarships</h4>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p>The <a class="clicktracker scholarshipsitelink" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website lists scholarships and funding schemes available to UCL students. These may be open to all students, or restricted to specific nationalities, regions or academic department.</p>

<section class="content-box modern-language-hoa-ba">
  
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Modern Language Plus BA</h2>

                        
                            <div class="copy__section copy__anchor scrollspy" id="standfirst">
                                <p class="copy__intro">The Modern Language Plus BA offers enormous choice and flexibility, combining a modern language (either one you have prior knowledge of, or one that is new to you), together with another discipline, such as philosophy, history of art, Jewish studies or management studies. You will also spend a year abroad.</p>
                            </div>
                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>
<p class="p"><strong>Applications for the Modern Language Plus History of Art combined honours programme are made via the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs" target="_self">UCL School of European Languages, Culture &amp; Society</a></strong></p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Key Facts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<div class="prebox">
<section class="box box--None">
  
  <i class="fa None"></i>

<p class="p">4 years</p>

<p class="p">15 January 2016</p>

  </section> 
 
  <section class="middle-split__column2">

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry and Application</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Entry and Application</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Modern Language Plus BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="entry-requirements">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Entry requirements</h3>
                                
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <h4>A Levels</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Grades</dt>
                                        <dd>AAA-ABB depending on the subject combination (see the <a href='https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modern-languages-plus/entry-requirements'>SELCS web page on entry requirements</a>)</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>The following is required if part of the combination: English Literature or English Language and Literature grade A; French grade A; Latin grade A; Spanish grade A. For all other combinations a foreign language is preferred.</dd>
                                        
                                        
                                        <dt>GCSEs</dt>
                                        <dd>English Language at grade B or 6, plus Mathematics at grade C or 5. For UK-based students, a grade C or 5 or equivalent in a foreign language (other than Ancient Greek, Biblical Hebrew or Latin) is required. UCL provides opportunities to meet the foreign language requirement following enrolment, further details at: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs">www.ucl.ac.uk/ug-reqs</a></dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <h4>IB Diploma</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>Points</dt>
                                        <dd>34-38 points depending on the subject combination (see the <a href='https://www.ucl.ac.uk/selcs/study/undergraduate/modern-languages-plus/entry-requirements'>SELCS web page on entry requirements</a>).</dd>
                                        <dt>Subjects</dt>
                                        <dd>A score of 16-18 points in three higher level subjects, to include the following if part of degree combination: English A1 at grade 6; French at grade 6; Latin at grade 6; Spanish at grade 6. For all other combinations a foreign language is preferred. No score below 5.</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    
                                    <h5>UK applicants qualifications</h5>
                                    <p>For entry requirements with other UK qualifications accepted by UCL, choose your qualification from the list below:</p>
                                    <div class="dropdown">
                                        <select class="dropdown__inner dropdown_uk_qualifications">
                                            <option
    id="resetit-ubalngsmop06">Select qualification</option>
                                            <option
    id="btec-ubalngsmop06">BTEC National Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="accessCourse-ubalngsmop06">Access to HE Diploma</option>
                                            <option
    id="preU-ubalngsmop06">Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects</option>
                                            <option
    id="scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsmop06">Scottish Advanced Highers</option>
                                            <option
    id="welshBacc-ubalngsmop06">Welsh Baccalaureate</option>
                                        </select>
                                    </div>
                                    <div
    class="box box--copy">
                                        <h5
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-heading">Equivalent qualification</h5>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-btec-ubalngsmop06">Not acceptable for entrance to this programme</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-accessCourse-ubalngsmop06">Pass in Access to HE Diploma, with between 28 credits awarded with Merit and a minimum of 23 credits awarded with Distinction in the Level 3 units, the remainder of the Level 3 units awarded with Merit.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-preU-ubalngsmop06">D3,D3,D3 - D3,M1,M1 in three Cambridge Pre-U Principal Subjects.  The following is required if part of the combination: English Literature or English Language &amp; Literature grade D3; French grade D3; German grade M1; Latin grade D3; Spanish grade D3.  For all other combinations a foreign language is preferred.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-scotAdvancedHighers-ubalngsmop06">AAA-ABB at Advanced Highers (or AA at Advanced Higher and AAA at Higher - AB at Advanced Higher and BBB at Higher).  The following is required at Advanced Higher if part of the combination: English Literature or English Language &amp; Literature grade A; French grade A; German grade B; Latin grade A; Spanish grade A.  For all other combinations a foreign language is preferred.</p>
                                        <p
    class="alt-qualifications__hidden alt-qualifications__hidden-ubalngsmop06"
    id="info-welshBacc-ubalngsmop06">Depending on subject combination: Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades AAA or Successful completion of the WBQ Advanced Skills Challenge Certificate plus 2 GCE A-Levels at grades ABB. Please see A Levels for subject requirements.</p>
                                    </div>
                                    
                                        <h4>International applications</h4>
                                        <p>In addition to A level and International Baccalaureate, UCL considers a wide range of international qualifications for entry to its undergraduate degree programmes.</p>

                                            <input

    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-TZ">Tanzania</option>

    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-UZ">Uzbekistan</option>

    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-VE">Venezuela</option>

    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-VN">Vietnam</option>

    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-ZM">Zambia</option>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <option
    id="prosp-ubalngsmop06-country-ZW">Zimbabwe</option>
                                                
                                            </select>
                                        </div>
                                        <div class="box box--copy">
                                            <p
    class="equiv-content equiv-content-ubalngsmop06"></p>
                                        </div>
                                    
                                    <h4>Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates</h4>
                                    <p>The Undergraduate Preparatory Certificates (UPCs) are intensive one-year foundation courses for international students of high academic potential who are aiming to gain access to undergraduate degree programmes at UCL and other top UK universities.</p>
                                    <p>Typical UPC students will be high achievers in a 12-year school system which does not meet the standard required for direct entry to UCL.</p>
                                    <p>For more information see: <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/upc" >www.ucl.ac.uk/upc</a>.</p>
                                    <h4>English language requirements</h4>
                                    <p>If your education has not been conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency. Information about the evidence required, acceptable qualifications and test providers can be found on our <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/requirements/english-requirements'>English language requirements</a> page.</p>
                                    <p>The English language level for this programme is: <b>Advanced</b></p>
                                    <p>A variety of English language programmes are offered at the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/clie">UCL Centre for Languages & International Education</a>.</p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy zero-bottom" id="application">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>

                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                    
                                        <h4>Your application</h4>
                                        <p><p>In your application, you should demonstrate an interest in the literature, culture and history of the language you are proposing to study. Involvement in cultural activities in the language (i.e. reading newspapers and magazines, watching television and films or engaging with relevant communities) is regarded favourably, as is travel to the country in question.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>How to apply</h4>
                                    <p>Application for admission should be made through UCAS (the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service). Applicants currently at school or college will be provided with advice on the process; however, applicants who have left school or who are based outside the United Kingdom may obtain information directly from UCAS.</p>
                                    <p>When applying for a place on this programme please submit your application to the Modern Language Plus BA. All applicants will then be contacted to confirm the chosen combination of lanugage/subject they wish to be considered for. Please note that French and Spanish are not taught from beginner's level so an A level or equivalent is therefore required for these combinations.</p>
                                    <p>
                                        <strong>Application deadline:</strong>
                                        15 January 2018                    
                                    </p>
                                    
                                    <br />
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li>
                                            
                                                    <a
    class="btn cta" href="http://www.ucas.com"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','UG (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ba-ch'])">Apply through UCAS</a>
                                          
                                        </li>
                                        <li>
                                            <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/undergraduate/application/application/how-to-apply">Application guidelines</a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul> 
                                    <br /><br />
                                    <h4>Selection</h4>
                                    <p><p>If your application demonstrates that your academic ability and motivation makes you well-suited to our degree and you receive an offer, then we shall invite you to a post-offer open day, where you can experience the sort of teaching that we offer and life in SELCS.</p></p>
                                    <p><p>Our admissions process aims to assess your linguistic abilities and attainments as well as cultural awareness and intellectual potential. We may interview candidates by telephone in order to establish a level of language ability.</p></p>
                                    <p>For further information on UCL's selection process see: <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/application/selection'>Selection of students</a>.</p>
                                    <ul class="list-unstyled list-inline list-inline--btn hidden-lg">
                                        <li><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/ucl-plus" class="btn btn--secondary">Request a printed prospectus <i class="icon icon--book icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                        <li><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/download" class="btn btn--secondary">Download prospectus <i class="icon icon--download icon--push-left pull-right"></i></a>
                                        </li>
                                    </ul>
                                    <br /><br />
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        
                        
                        
                            <section>
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Programme contacts</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul
    class="list-unstyled">

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Summary</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Degree Summary</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Modern Language Plus BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="degree-benefits">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree benefits</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <ul>
                                        <li><p>UCL provides an ideal environment for language study; we offer an enormous range of languages and state-of-the-art facilities, including a well-equipped language learning suite.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>The Centre for Excellence in Teaching and Learning - Languages of the Wider World, run by UCL and SOAS, brings together the expertise of a wide range of language specialists.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>UCL has a large international population, and you will have countless opportunities to practise and speak your chosen languages with native speakers and learn about the associated culture and society.</p></li>
                                        <li><p>Our location in a cosmopolitan city provides access to frequent and varied cultural events, a huge range of museums, specialist libraries and bookshops, theatres, cinemas, cuisines and cultural societies.</p></li>
                                    </ul>
                                    
                                    
                                        <h2>Research Excellence Framework (REF) 2014</h2>
                                        <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                        
                                        <p>The following REF score was awarded to the department: School of European Languages, Culture and Society.</p>
                                        <ul>
                                            <li>74% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)</li>
                                        </ul>
                                        <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Structure</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Degree Structure</h1>

<h2 class="heading">Year 1 </h2>








<h4 class="heading">Compulsory courses
                                            </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                Courses in your chosen language<br />Courses in your second discipline<br />Literature, culture, history and linguistics courses related to your chosen language
                                            </p>

<h2 class="heading">Year 2</h2>








<h4 class="heading">
                                                Compulsory courses
                                            </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                Courses in your chosen language<br /> Courses in your second discipline<br />Literature, culture, history and linguistics courses related to your chosen language
                                            </p>

<h2 class="heading">Year 3</h2>








<h4 class="heading">
                                                Year abroad
                                            </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                Year abroad in the country where your chosen language is spoken.<br />Students currently complete a 4,000-word Year Abroad Project in the target language, and:<br />
Any assessment required by a host university (if participating in a university exchange), or:<br />
A British Council Assistant-ship or work placement abroad.
                                            </p>

<h2 class="heading">Year 4</h2>








<h4 class="heading">
                                                Compulsory courses
                                            </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                Advanced language and other courses in your chosen fields.
                                            </p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Careers</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Modern Language Plus BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="careers">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>There are many career opportunities for UCL's modern language graduates, and we embed within our teaching the acquisition of transferable skills as well as linguistic and cultural knowledge.</p></p>
                                    
                                        <p><p>Career paths for modern language graduates include the financial sector, the civil service, journalism, accountancy, publishing, education, advertising, the media and law. Some graduates pursue careers that make special use of their language skills, including translating, interpreting and teaching; others continue with training and research.</p></p>
                                    
                                    <h4>Destinations</h4>
                                    <p>First career destinations of recent graduates (2013-2015) of this programme include:</p>
                                    <ul>
                                        
                                            <li>TEFL (Teaching English as a Foreign Language) Teacher, Apollo Vietnam</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Analyst, J.P. Morgan</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MA in Issues in Modern Culture at UCL</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Freelance Journalist, BBC</li>
                                        
                                        
                                            <li>Full-time student, MA in Philosophy at King's College London</li>
                                        
                                    </ul>
                        
                                    
                                    <p
    class="small text-muted">Data taken from the 'Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education' survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013-2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                    <p>UCL is commited to helping you get the best start after graduation. Read more about how UCL Careers and UCL Innovation and Enterprise can <a href='http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/employability/careers-skills'>help you find employment or learn about entrepreneurship</a>.</p>
                                    
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>
                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Fees and Funding</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div><h1 class="heading">Fees and Funding</h1>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/ug-tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                    var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-undergraduate';</script>

        
            
                
                

                   <div class="prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        <h2>Modern Language Plus BA</h2>

                        

                        
        
                        
            
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__anchor collapse scrollspy" id="fees-and-funding">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Fees and funding</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                
                                    <h4>Fees</h4>
                                    <dl class="dl-inline">
                                        <dt>UK/EU students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;9,250 (2018/19)</dd>
                                        <dt>Overseas students</dt>
                                        <dd>&#163;19,390 (2018/19)</dd>
                                    </dl>
                                    <p>Full details of UCL's tuition fees, tuition fee policy and potential increases to fees can be found on the <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/students/fee-schedules-2018-2019-undergraduate">UCL Students website</a>.</p>

                                    <h4>Funding</h4>
                                    <p>Various funding options are available, including student loans, scholarships and bursaries. UK students whose household income falls below a certain level may also be eligible for a non-repayable bursary or for certain scholarships. Please see the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/fees-funding">Fees and funding</a> pages for more details.</p>
                                    

                                    
                    
                                    <h4>Departmental scholarships</h4>
                                    
                                    
                                        <p>The <a class="clicktracker scholarshipsitelink" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding</a> website lists scholarships and funding schemes available to UCL students. These may be open to all students, or restricted to specific nationalities, regions or academic department.</p>
                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        

                        
                        
                        
            
                        

                        
                    </div>

  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;

    var js = this.createElement("script");

  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

            }

                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script> 

        <script src="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/require.min.js"></script>
        <script src='//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/skins/UCLIndigoSkin/default-theme/main.js'></script>
        <script>require(['app/general','theme/indigo-autocomplete-ga','theme/silva','app/searchWithAutoComplete','app/lightbox',]);//load the default stuff</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>
