    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-US">United States of America</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-UY">Uruguay</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-UZ">Uzbekistan</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-VE">Venezuela</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-VN">Vietnam</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-ZM">Zambia</option>
                                    
                                    
                                        <option
    id="prosp-TMAHARSING01-country-ZW">Zimbabwe</option>
                                    
                                </select>
                            </p>
                            <div
    class="box--alt tagged country-select__content country-select__content-TMAHARSING01 is-hidden">
                                <div class="tag tag--taught">
                                    <span class="tag__heading">International equivalencies</span>
                                </div>
                                <p
    class="equiv-content-TMAHARSING01"></p>
                            </div>
                        </section>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        


                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--application collapse">
                                <h3 id="application" class="copy__heading collapse__header">Application and next steps</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        <h4>Applications</h4>
                                        <p>Students are advised to apply as early as possible due to competition for places. Those applying for scholarship funding (particularly overseas applicants) should take note of application deadlines.</p>
                                        <div class="clearfix">
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                                
                                                    <h5>Who can apply?</h5>
                                                    <p><p>The programme is designed for those with a first degree in history of art, or with some experience of the subject, who have a high level of commitment and an aptitude for academic work.</p></p>
                                                
                                                <div>
                                                    <h5>Application deadlines</h5>
                                                    <dl class="list--defined">
                                                        
                                                            <dt>All applicants</dt>
                                                            <dd>1 March 2018</dd>
                                                        
                                                        
                                                        
                                                    </dl>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                    
                                                </div>
                                                
                                                    <br><p>For more information see our <a
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply">Applications</a> page.</p>
                                                    <a
    class="cta btn prospectus"
    href="/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','PGT (widget) apply clicks','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ma'])">Apply now</a>
                                                
                                            </div>
                                            <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                                <h5>What are we looking for?</h5>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_1"><p>When we assess your application we would like to learn:</p><ul> 

<li>why you want to study History of Art at graduate level</li> <li>why you want to study History of Art at UCL</li> <li>what particularly attracts you to this programme </li> <li>how your academic and/or professional background meets the demands of this challenging programme </li> <li>where you would like to go professionally with your degree </li> 

</ul><p>Together with essential academic requirements, the personal statement is your opportunity to elaborate on your reasons for applying to this programme and how your interests match what the programme will deliver. It is essential to study the departmental website carefully in order to write a meaningful statement.</p></p>
                                                <p
    condition="app_look_2"></p>
                                            </div>
                                        </div>
                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>        
                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Degree Information</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--degree__information collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Degree Information</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>Students develop skills for engaging with visual materials and gain historical knowledge, enabling them to interpret artefacts in relation to their social and cultural contexts. They are introduced to current methodological debates in the field and encouraged to define their own position through reasoned historical and theoretical arguments.</p></p>
                                    <p>Students undertake modules to the value of 180 credits.</p>
                                    <p><p>The programme consists of a core module (30 credits), two optional modules (60 credits) and a research dissertation (90 credits).</p></p>
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                    
                                    <div class="clearfix">
                                        <div class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                            <h5>Core modules</h5>
                                            
                                                
                                                <ul>
                                                    
                                                        <li>Methods, Debates and Sources in History of Art</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                </ul>
                                                
                                            
                                            
                                            <h5>Optional modules</h5>
                                            
                                                <div><p>Options may include the following:</p></div>
                                                <ul>
                                                    
                                                        <li>Human and Non-Human in Medieval Art</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Transformations of the Body in Early Modern Cabinets of Display</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Vision, Tourism, Imperialism: Art and Travel in the British Empire, 1760-1870</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>American Media: Publicity and the Logics of Surveillance</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Politics of the Image: Germany 1890-1945</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Art as Theory: The Writing of Art</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Art and Technology in Nineteenth-Century France</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Photographic Cultures: Photography's Publics and the Production of Politics</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>On Sex and Violence</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Race/Place: Exotic/Erotic</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Tracing the Body: Technologies of Representation in 18th and 19th-Century France</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        <li>Seeing Through Materials: Matter, Vision, and Transformation in the Renaissance</li>
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                    
                                                </ul>
                                                
                                            
                                            
                                        </div>
                                        <div class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                            
                                                <h5>Dissertation/report</h5>
                                                <p><p>All MA students undertake an independent research project which culminates in a dissertation of approximately 13,000 words.</p></p>
                                            
                                            <h5>Teaching and Learning</h5>
                                            <p><p>The programme is delivered through a combination of lectures, seminars, tutorials, as well as gallery and museum visits. Assessment is by two essays for each of the taught modules (six essays in all), the dissertation and a viva.</p></p>
                                            
                                            
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                                    <p class="clearfix">
                                        Further information on modules and degree structure is available on the department website: 
                                        <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ma">History of Art MA</a>
                                    </p>
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
    

                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--why__ucl collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Why study this degree at UCL?</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    
                                        
                                            <p><p>UCL History of Art is one of the most dynamic centres for the study of art history and visual cultures in the world. It is one of the leading departments in the UK for research; and all staff are active researchers in a range of specialist fields. Our teaching and research move beyond traditional forms of art history to address visual and material cultures more broadly, and we are committed to a wide range of critical and historiographical enquiry.&nbsp;</p></p>
                                            <p><p>The MA in History of Art is a challenging and versatile degree; you will study in a community of approximately 40 graduate students; at the same time you will work in smaller groups and in close contact with tutors in your special subject courses.</p></p>
                                            <p><p>The department is located in Bloomsbury, close to the Warburg Institute, the British Library, and the British Museum. The National Gallery, Tate Galleries, and the Victoria and Albert Museum are also within easy reach. UCL's own Art Museum holds many rare and important works.</p></p>
                                        
                                        
                                        <p>
                                            <strong>Department:</strong> <a
    href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history"
    class="clicktracker departmenttaught">History of Art</a>
                                        </p>
                                        <p>
                                            <strong>Student / staff ratios</strong>
                                            
                                                &rsaquo; 17 staff
                                                
                                                    including 4 postdocs
                                                
                                            
                                            
                                                &rsaquo; 45 taught students
                                            
                                            
                                                &rsaquo; 40 research students
                                            
                                        </p>
                                        
                                            <h4>Research Excellence Framework (REF)</h4>
                                            
                                            <p>The <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework</a>, or REF, is the system for assessing the quality of research in UK higher education institutions. The 2014 REF was carried out by the UK's higher education funding bodies, and the results used to allocate research funding from 2015/16.</p>
                                            <p>
                                                The following REF score was awarded to the department: History of Art<br />
                                                85% rated 4* (&#145;world-leading&#146;) or 3* (&#145;internationally excellent&#146;)
                                            </p>
                                            <p>Learn more about the scope of UCL's research, and browse case studies, on our <a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/impact/">Research Impact website</a>.</p>
                                        
                                        

                                    

                                    
                                </div>
                            </section>
                        


                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                    

                
            
        
    
</html>

</div>
  </dd>

                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">

                            <p>September 2018</p>

                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--funding collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Funding</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    <p><p>The department awards several bursaries covering a proportion of fees to Master's or Research students.</p></p>
                                    

                                    


                                    <!-- scholarships listed here -->
                                    
                                    
                                        <p>For a comprehensive list of the funding opportunities available at UCL, including funding relevant to your nationality, please visit the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a>.</p>

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<html>

    
        <script>
            require(["theme/tabs"]);
            require(["theme/ug"]);
        </script>
        <script>            var ajaxyear = '2018';
                                                var ajaxroot = 'http://www.ucl.ac.uk/indigo-ucl-prospectus-taught-degrees';</script>
        



            
                
                

                 <div class="prospectus--programme prospectus--programme--last">
                        

                        

                        

                        
                            
       
            <section id="key-information" class="copy__section copy__section--key__information">
                <div class="island island--highlight island--subtle-highlight clearfix">
                    <h3 class="copy__heading">Key Information</h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                    

                    
                        <div class="clearfix">
                            <h5>Programme starts</h5>
                            <p>September 2018</p>
                        </div>
                    

                    <section class="threecolumns">
                        

                        

                        
                    </section>

                    

                    

                    

                   <div>
                        
                        
                        <div>
                            <strong>Location:</strong> London, Bloomsbury
                        </div>
                    </div>

                    <hr class="clearfix">
                    
                </div>
            </section>
        
    
                        

                        


                        

                        
    
       
                        
                            <section class="copy__section copy__section--careers collapse">
                                <h3 class="copy__heading collapse__header">Careers</h3>
                                <div class="collapse__content">
                                    

                                    <p><p>UCL's History of Art graduates have an excellent record of success in entering PhD programmes, careers in museums and galleries, the art trade, the heritage industry, art publishing, and art conservation. The unique combination of visual analysis and intellectual rigour offered by the MA has also proven valuable in diverse careers including journalism, publishing, and advertising. For those aspiring to an academic career, the MA is a requirement for a PhD, and many former MA students have successfully received funding for research degrees, and subsequently obtained academic positions, at prestigious institutions in the UK, North America, and elsewhere.</p></p>
                                    <div class="clearfix">

                                        <div
    class="copy__column dc1-dc2">
                                            <h5>Recent career destinations for this degree</h5>
                                            <ul>
                                                
                                                    <li>Assistant Curator, Victoria and Albert Museum</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>Gallery Co-Ordinator, Frith Street Gallery</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>PhD in History of Art, The Courtauld Institute of Art</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>Museum Intern, Peggy Guggenheim Collection</li>
                                                
                                                
                                                    <li>Exhibitions Assistant, Whitechapel Gallery</li>
                                                
                                            </ul>
                                        </div>
                                        <div
    class="copy__column dc3-dc4">
                                            <h5>Employability</h5>
                                            <p><p>Our History of Art MA provides focused training in the history of art and its methodologies. It encourages students to develop original critical thinking on all aspects of visual culture, and promotes a serious engagement with historical and contemporary cultural debates. You will learn how to work collaboratively as well as independently to develop your skills in written and oral communications. The MA is an excellent starting point for a career in academia, curating, for working in the heritage industry, commercial art galleries, and other sectors of the cultural industries.&nbsp;</p></p>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>

                                     <div class="clearfix">

                                        
                                    </div>

                                    <div class="clearfix">

                                        <div
    class="copy__column">
                                            <p
    class="small text-muted">Careers data is taken from the ‘Destinations of Leavers from Higher Education’ survey undertaken by HESA looking at the destinations of UK and EU students in the 2013–2015 graduating cohorts six months after graduation.</p>
                                        </div>
                                    </div>
                               </div>
                            </section>
                        
    

                        


                        
                        
                        
    
                        

                        

                        

                        
                    </div>

                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ma/ma-accordion/tel%3A+44%20%280%2920%203108%204011
                                      <br /><br />
                                    </p>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>Retype the address.</li>
                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>
                                          <li>Go to <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk" title="UCL Website">www.ucl.ac.uk</a> and look for the information you want.</li>
                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage. 
                                    </p>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">History of Art MPhil/PhD</h1>
<p class="p">The UCL History of Art Department is
	  top-rated for research; our staff are active
	  researchers in a range of specialist fields
	  and there is a thriving graduate community.
	  Graduate students participate in our weekly
	  graduate seminar, and research students
	  also write, edit and produce the journal
<a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/object" target="_self"> <em>Object</em></a>. We also offer opportunities for
	  research students to work as Teaching
	  Assistants in the department, these opportunities will be posted on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-phd-mphil/news-events" target="_self">Latest News and Events</a> feed. <br /></p>
<p class="p">  Our ongoing
	  and extensive contact with other Art History
	  departments in the University of London
	  facilitates joint skills training as well as
	  interchanges and communication in shared
	  seminars and public events. <br /></p>
<p class="p">
 Our proximity to and cordial relations with
	  national museums and galleries, such as
	  the British Museum, afford access to
	  innumerable artefacts and artworks.
	  UCL's own Art Collections hold many rare
  and important works. </p>






<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Key Facts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>



<h4 class="heading">Degree Programme</h4>



<p class="p">History of Art MPhil/PhD</p>



<h4 class="heading">Duration</h4>



<ul class="disc">
<li>Full-time: 3 years</li>
<li>Part-time: 5 years</li>
</ul>



<h4 class="heading">Subject area</h4>



<p class="p"><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/undergraduate/subject-areas/history-art" target="_self">History of Art</a></p>


<h3 class="heading">Faculty overview:</h3>




<p class="p"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/shs" target="_self">
          Faculty of Social and Historical Sciences</a> </p>


<h3 class="heading">Current research student numbers:</h3>




<p class="p"> 45</p>


<h3 class="heading">Research Excellence Framework</h3>




<p class="p"> 85% rated 4* (‘world-leading’) or 3* (‘internationally excellent’)</p>
<p class="p"> What is the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ref2014">Research Excellence Framework?</a></p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry and Application</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>


<h3 class="heading"></h3>






<h3 class="heading"> </h3>




<p class="p">We welcome applications to
our research programme from candidates wishing to pursue research in a wide
range of fields covering the history of art and visual culture from the Middle
Ages to contemporary art. Candidates interested in applying for an <strong>MPhil/PhD </strong>must present a
proposal for the topic they are intending to pursue under the supervision of an
individual member of staff. Please familiarise yourself with the research
expertise of members of our academic staff by using the individual pages on our
departmental website.</p>
<p class="p">For further information on application
procedures, please contact the departmental <a href="mailto:r.sanjuan@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Research Tutor</a>. The application itself is submitted via
UCL’s electronic submission system.</p>


<h3 class="heading">Application deadlines</h3>




<p class="p">Research degrees may start
any time of the year, but typically start with the beginning of the academic
year in September. Deadlines and start date are usually dictated by funding
arrangements. Candidates who wish to be considered for funding should contact
us no later than the beginning of December, and need to submit their
applications to UCL no later than the first week of January.</p>
<p class="p">For more information see our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/apply/research/how-to-apply">How to apply</a> page.</p>
<p class="clearfix">
 <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/apply"
    class="cta btn cta-quarter pull-left"
    onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent','CTA','Click','http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/apply'])">

   Apply Now

 </a>
</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">Entry Requirements</h3>




<p class="p">Candidates for the <strong>MPhil </strong>are normally required to
have obtained an MA degree in the History of Art, or an equivalent overseas
qualification. Candidates for the <strong>PhD </strong>register
initially for an <strong>MPhil </strong>which
can be upgraded to a <strong>PhD </strong>at
the end of the first year on the successful presentation of a chapter to the
Graduate Teaching Committee.</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">English Language Requirements</h3>




<p class="p">If your education has not been 
conducted in the English language, you will be expected to demonstrate 
evidence of an adequate level of English proficiency.</p>
<p class="p">The English language level for this programme is: <strong>Good</strong></p>
<p class="p">Further information can be found on our <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/graduate/life/international/english-requirements">English language requirements</a> page.</p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">International students</h3>




<p class="p"> Country-specific information, 
including details of when UCL representatives are visiting your part of 
the world, can be obtained from the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international">International Students website</a>.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Research Areas</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> The Department’s academic focus is on research and teaching
 excellence within a chronological span from c. 1100 to the present in 
relation to the art of the western tradition and its global encounters. 
 Research strengths include:
</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>


<h4 class="heading">Materials and Materiality</h4>




</li>
<li>


<h4 class="heading">Sexuality and the Body</h4>



</li>
<li>


<h4 class="heading">Media and Technologies</h4>



</li>
<li>


<h4 class="heading">Politics and the Stakes of History</h4>



</li>
<li>


<h4 class="heading">Contemporary Art and Critical Theory</h4>



</li>
</ul>
<hr class="rule" />
<p class="p"><em></em></p>
<p class="p">  The Department is recognised for its long-standing 
commitment to critical theory. Our research engages with active debates 
around phenomenology, film theory, psychoanalytic theory, and Marxist 
and feminist traditions of art history.</p>
<p class="p">  Our academic work attracts outstanding students from 
across the world. Graduates have gone on to successful careers in 
teaching and research, museums and galleries, publishing, and library 
and visual resource management.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Careers</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">Recent graduates have been awarded prestigious post-doctoral fellowship and secured academic positions at 
top universities and research institutes in the UK, Europe, North 
America and Asia. Many have also pursued successful curatorial careers 
at major museums and collections in Britain, including Tate Modern, the 
Hayward Gallery, The Victoria and Albert Museum, the Barbican Art 
Gallery and many more including museum and galleries abroad. Others work
 as art journalists or in publishing. </p>


<h3 class="heading">Top career destinations for this degree</h3>




<ul class="disc">
<li>
                                                Lecturer, Courtauld Institute of Art
                                                (2011)
                                            </li>
<li>
                                                Curator, Tate Modern
                                                (2012)
                                            </li>
<li>Post-doctoral Fellowship, British Academy
                                                (2011)
                                            </li>
<li>
                                                Assistant Professor, McGill University
                                                (2011)
                                            </li>
<li>
                                                Lecturer, Edinburgh University
                                                (2012)
                                            </li>
</ul>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">Employability</h3>




<p class="p">The PhD in the History of Art requires independent, self-motivated research and will teach students to
 formulate and convey their ideas both within specialised areas as well 
as within broader audiences. It will enable the student to develop 
original thinking on all aspects of visual culture, drawing on 
historical and contemporary cultural debates. Students gain experience 
of working in different kinds of archives and with different approaches 
to visual material. PhD students are trained to work as teaching 
assistants in the department, and the combination of research and 
teaching skills prepares them for the diverse demands of an academic 
career. </p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">Networking</h3>




<p class="p">A PhD in Art History also 
prepares students to take up senior curatorial or management positions 
in museums or the heritage industry. Our research students have the 
opportunity to participate in the editing of the journal <em>Object</em>, an experience particularly valuable for pursuing a career in art, academic and general culture-related publishing.</p>
<hr class="rule" />

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Fees and Funding</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>


<h3 class="heading">Tuition Fees (2018/19)</h3>







<h4 class="heading">UK/EU:</h4>



<p class="p">£5060 (FT) £2530 (PT) </p>



<h4 class="heading">Overseas:</h4>



<p class="p">£19580 (FT) £9850 (PT) </p>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading">AHRC Scholarships</h2>






<h2 class="heading"></h2>






<h2 class="heading"> </h2>





<p class="p">The department typically
secures 4-5 AHRC scholarships for Home/EU students. AHRC scholarships are
awarded and administered by the London Arts and Humanities Partnership (LAHP). Applicants
for these scholarships must apply to the UCL History of Art research degree
before applying for funding via LAHP</p>
<p class="p">Applicants should have applied to UCL by the middle of December. Then students should make their own application to LAHP by <strong>21 January 2018</strong>.<br /> </p>
<p class="p"><a href="http://www.lahp.ac.uk/" target="_self">www.lahp.ac.uk</a></p>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading">ORS/GRS and Wolfson Scholarships</h2>





<p class="p">Students should look over the conditions and requirements of each of these scholarships before applying.<br />Departments must nominate applicants to the Faculty for consideration, so to be considered for any of these scholarships students are also encouraged to apply to UCL by the middle of December, and then apply to the department for nomination for these by <strong>5pm on 5 Januaery 2018</strong>.<br /></p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading"> Overseas Graduate Bursary </h3>




<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>Value:</dt>
  <dd>
                                                Partial fee (Grant can be held in conjunction with GRS, see below)<br /></dd>
<dt>Eligibility:</dt>
  <dd>Overseas students</dd>
</dl>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships/graduate/UK-EU_Res/grs" target="_self">UCL Graduate Research Scholarship (GRS)</a> </h3>




<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>Value:</dt>
  <dd>
                                                Maintenance
                                                
                                            </dd>
<dt>Eligibility:</dt>
  <dd>
                                                All students
                                            </dd>
</dl>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading"> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/ah/figs/wolfson-postgraduate-scholarship">Wolfson Scholarships</a> </h3>




<dl class="dl" compact="compact">
<dt>Value:</dt>
  <dd>
                                                £27,000
                                                
                                                    (3 years)
                                                
                                            </dd>
<dt>Eligibility:</dt>
  <dd>
                                                UK, EU, Overseas students
                                            </dd>
<dt>Criteria:</dt>
  <dd>Based on academic merit</dd>
<dt> <br /></dt>
  <dd> <br /></dd>
</dl>
<hr class="rule" />

<h2 class="heading">Departmental funding 2017-18</h2>





<p class="p"> The department is pleased to offer the following scholarships:</p>
<ul class="disc">
<li>Department Research Studentship (UK/EU students only)</li>
<li>Critical Histories of Art Studentship (UK/EU students only)</li>
<li>History
of Art Alumni Studentship (Overseas students)</li>
<li>Departmental Half-Fees Bursary (Overseas students only) </li>
</ul>

<h2 class="heading">Eligibility</h2>





<p class="p">The competition for the <strong>Department Research Studentship</strong>
and for the <strong>Critical Histories of Art Studentship</strong> is open to Home/EU
students holding an offer to commence a research degree in the department in
autumn 2018. The <strong>History of Art Alumni
Studentship</strong> is open to new overseas students holding an offer to commence a
research degree in the department in autumn 2018. The <strong>Departmental
Half-Fees Bursary</strong> is normally awarded to new and current overseas
students who do not have other (or insufficient) sources of funding.</p>

<h2 class="heading">The Awards</h2>





<p class="p"><strong>Departmental Research Studentship in History
of Art</strong><br /></p>
<p class="p">The Award is meant to attract an outstanding PhD student and to provide this student
with teaching experience, a valuable part of his or her development and
preparation for an academic career.</p>
<p class="p">The studentship covers UCL
tuition fees and provides a maintenance stipend of £16,000 per year. It lasts
for three years, must be held full-time, and may not be held concurrently with
any other substantial award. As part of the studentship, the holder will be
required to serve as teaching assistant on a one-term course each of the three
years. These will follow a progression of teaching responsibility that we
envision culminating in sole responsibility for an Art in London course
(subject to availability). The remuneration for these teaching duties is
included within the stipend. Successful candidates are also expected to play a
full part in the Department’s activities.</p>
<p class="p">The studentship will be awarded
on the basis of </p>
<p class="p">a) An outstanding PhD proposal</p>
<p class="p">b) An excellent academic track
record (usually documented by first class BA and MA degrees)</p>
<p class="p">c) Evidence of an aptitude for
and commitment to teaching in History of Art as a career</p>
<p class="p"><strong>Critical
Histories of Art Studentship (UK/EU students only)</strong></p>
<p class="p">The award is meant to attract an
outstanding PhD student who is particularly committed to new critical approaches
to the History of Art and aims to pursue an academic career. The studentship
covers UCL tuition fees and provides a maintenance stipend of £16,000 per year.
It lasts for three years, must be held full-time, and may not be held
concurrently with any other substantial award.</p>
<p class="p">a) An outstanding PhD proposal</p>
<p class="p">b) An excellent academic track
record (usually documented by first class BA and MA degrees)</p>
<p class="p"><strong>History
of Art Alumni Studentship</strong></p>
<p class="p">The award is offered to an outstanding overseas
research student who aims to pursue an academic career. The studentship normally
covers UCL overseas tuition fees. It lasts for three years, must be held full
time and can be held in conjunction with other scholarships.</p>
<p class="p"><strong> </strong></p>

<h2 class="heading">Application</h2>





<p class="p"> Students wishing to be considered for the awards should submit the
following materials: </p>
<p class="p"> a) an informal letter indicating their wish to be considered for the
scholarship(s). This should, in the case of the Departmental Research
Studentship in History of Art, include a statement (max. 250 words) on their
commitment to teaching as an academic career.</p>
<p class="p"> All applicants also have to declare any other sources of funding</p>
<p class="p"> b) a copy of their research proposal (c 1500 words). This may be the
same proposal submitted with the application for the programme, or an updated
version</p>
<p class="p"> c) An updated CV</p>
<p class="p"><strong>Departmental
Half-Fees Bursary</strong></p>
<p class="p">Applicants are asked to submit an informal letter indicating
their wish to be considered for the bursary.</p>

<h2 class="heading"> Application
Deadline</h2>





<p class="p"> Applications should be submitted by<strong> Monday 23 April 2018. </strong>Applications
received after this deadline cannot be considered. Any queries should be
addressed to the Department’s Research Tutor, <a href="mailto:r.sanjuan@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Rose Marie San Juan</a>. Materials should be submitted in hard copy
or as pdf document (please collate all materials in one file) to <a href="mailto:l.sperring@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">Lauren Sperring</a> in the
departmental office. </p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading"><a href="http://www.grad.ucl.ac.uk/funds/" target="_self">UCL Graduate School</a></h3>




<p class="p">Through courses, inter-disciplinary programmes, and scholarships we 
encourage research students to look beyond the boundaries of their 
chosen discipline, as well as sharing and broadening knowledge across 
disciplines through societies and competitions.  All of these activities
 are detailed on this website with links to all elements of the doctoral
 research training environment here at UCL.</p>
<hr class="rule" />
<p class="p">More scholarships are listed on the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/scholarships">Scholarships and Funding website</a></p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Programme Contacts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<ul class="disc">
<li><strong> 
                                        Ms Lauren Sperring
                                        </strong></li>
<li>Graduate Support Officer<strong><br /></strong></li>
<li> <a href="mailto:l.sperring@ucl.ac.uk">l.sperring@ucl.ac.uk</a> </li>
<li> <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-phd-mphil/phd-accordion/tel:+44%20%280%2920%203108%204011">+44 (0)20 3108 4011</a></li>
</ul>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
</dl>

                                    <h2 class="heading">The resource cannot be found</h2>
                                    <p class="p">
                                      <acronym title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</acronym>:
                                      http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-phd-mphil/phd-accordion/tel%3A+44%20%280%2920%203108%204011
                                      <br /><br />

                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      Most likely causes:
                                    </h4>
                                      <ul>
                                          <li>There might be a typing error in the address.</li>
                                          <li>If you clicked on a link, it may be out of date.</li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      What you can try:
                                    </h4>

                                          <li>Use the search box above to find what you're looking for.</li>

                                          <li><a href="javascript:history.back()" title="Back to previous page">Go back to the previous page.</a></li>
                                      </ul>
                                    <h4 class="heading">
                                      More information:
                                    </h4>
                                    <p class="p">
                                        This error (<acronym title="Hypertext Transfer Protocol">HTTP</acronym> 404 Not Found) means that you have connected to the UCL Website, but the page you wanted was not found. It's possible that the webpage is temporarily unavailable. Alternatively, the UCL Website might have changed or removed the webpage.

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">Study Abroad/Affiliates</h1>

<h2 class="heading">History of Art Majors</h2>





<hr class="rule" />
<p class="p"><strong>For full details on all aspects please refer to the:</strong><a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/study-abroad-guide" target="_self"> <strong>Study Abroad Guide</strong></a></p>
<hr class="rule" />


<h3 class="heading">Key Information</h3>










<div id="accordion">

<dl class="accordion">
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Why UCL?</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>

<h2 class="heading">The UCL experience</h2>





<p class="p"> UCL has a well-established Study Abroad programme, 
welcoming students from colleges and universities around the world who 
wish to gain credit for courses taken at UCL in order to graduate from 
their home universities. Over 900 study abroad students come to UCL each
 year. They come from most parts of the world including the USA, Canada 
and Latin America, from Japan, China, Hong Kong, Singapore and South 
Korea, from Australia and from all over Europe. By choosing to join them
 you will benefit from a challenging and rewarding experience.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Integration</h2>





<p class="p"> At UCL we try to ensure that you gain the maximum benefit 
from your year or semester abroad. You will attend classes with regular 
degree students and will have the same course load, academic support and
 access to student services. Thus you will not only gain from the 
experience of studying in a different system but also from full 
integration with UK and other international students in classes. In 
return we expect you to be serious-minded in your wish to study; you 
must be willing to participate, keen to learn, and prepared to expend 
time and effort on your studies in order to reap the rewards of your 
time at UCL.</p>

<h2 class="heading">Teaching</h2>





<p class="p"> Much is expected of you, but equally, much is provided. 
While we value self-motivation and promote the acquisition of 
self-directed learning skills, you will benefit from an excellent 
academic infrastructure. There is an emphasis on small-group teaching 
and UCL enjoys one of the best staff to student ratios in the UK (1:10).
 In addition to lectures you will benefit from seminars and tutorials 
and, where appropriate, practical classes. </p>

<h2 class="heading">Academic support</h2>





<p class="p">





At UCL you will be supported to ensure that you fully 
achieve your academic potential. Every study abroad student at UCL is 
assigned a tutor. S/he will guide your choice of courses to be certain 
that it represents a coherent programme and meets with any requirements 
of your home institution. Tutorial support from friendly staff will 
ensure that you achieve maximum benefit from lectures and that you 
develop the necessary study skills to do well in the British academic 
system.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Entry and Application</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>


<h3 class="heading">Application Process</h3>




<p class="p"><a href="https://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/study-abroad-ucl/study-abroad-guide/how-to-apply" target="_self">How to Apply</a></p>


<h3 class="heading">Application Inquiries</h3>




<p class="p">WEB  

<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/international/affiliate" target="_self">www.ucl.ac.uk/affiliate</a><br />EMAIL <a href="mailto:affiliatestudents@ucl.ac.uk" target="_self">affiliatestudents [at] ucl.ac.uk</a><br />TEL +44 (0)20 7679 7742 / 7381<br />FAX +44 (0)20 7679 7691 / 3112</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Course Selection</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p">As a History of Art Study Abroad/International student also known as an Affiliate here at UCL you will have a Study Abroad/Affiliate Tutor <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/people/academic-staff/diana-dethloff" target="_self">Diana Dethloff</a> 
 who is here to give you detailed advice and guidance to help you make 
the best possible use of the wide range of opportunities available in 
the History of Art Department itself and in other departments at UCL.</p>
<p class="p">When you apply for admission to UCL, you will normally apply to one 
subject area (<a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/prospective-students/study-abroad-guide/application-study/subjects/search/subjects" target="_self">full list of degrees available</a>), where you
 will be expected to take at least 50% of your courses. Thereafter, you 
can select the remainder of your courses from other subject areas 
without the need for direct admission. This level of flexibility offers 
opportunities that many study abroad students take advantage of. 
Prerequisites may of course apply, to ensure that you have sufficient 
prior knowledge. Taking courses in other disciplines is also dependent 
on space on the relevant course being available.</p>
<p class="p">History of Art Affiliate students register for the same History of Art 
courses as
their UCL counterparts, this does depend on their background and level of
specialism within the discipline. Normally students take 
second year level courses while they are here. You can choose to 
specialise in courses within a
particular time period or to range more widely over the courses on
offer in any one year, perhaps combining courses in History of Art with
those in another UCL department. <br /></p>
<p class="p">Please see the <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students" target="_self">Prospective Students Undergraduate</a> section section of our website to read about the History of Art undergraduate degrees in more detail.</p>
<hr class="rule" />

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

<dt class="accordion__title"><a href="#">Programme Contacts</a></dt>
<dd class="accordion__description" style="display: none;">
     <div>
<p class="p"> As a History of Art Study Abroad - or 
Affiliate student as you will be known at UCL - you will have an 
Affiliate Tutor <a href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/international-study-abroad/accordion/art-history/people/people/academic-staff/diana-dethloff" target="_self">Diana Dethloff</a> 
 who is here to give you detailed advice and guidance to help you make 
the best possible use of the wide range of opportunities available in 
the History of Art Department itself and in other departments at UCL.</p>

</div>
  </dd>
        
    
    

    
    

    
</dl>
 

</div>



<h2 class="heading"></h2>








<h4 class="heading"></h4>

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 



  <blockquote class="pull-quote__wrap clearfix">
    <span class="pull-quote__start">"</span>
    I have really enjoyed the freedom to explore both major and minor 
elements of the subjects covered by the taught courses. My primary 
interest in Old Masters has been developed by one of my taught courses 
and by my choice of dissertation topic was in turn influenced by a 
seemingly unrelated course on nineteenth-century technology. It is the 
predominant focus on the visual (and indeed sometimes not-visual) in 
conjunction with a strong theoretical framework that develops the 
students of the History of Art MA into strong well-rounded critical 
thinkers.
  </blockquote>
  




<h4 class="heading">  James Baskerville </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                        History of Art MA
</p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

        <script>
            var cuttingTheMustard = document.querySelector && window.localStorage && window.addEventListener;

            Modernizr.load({
                //cutting the mustard as used by the BBC
                test : cuttingTheMustard
                //if old browser load the shiv
                ,nope : [
                    '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/html5shiv-printshiv.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.min.js'
                    ,'//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/respond.proxy.min.js'
                ]
            });
            //set conditional assets for main.js
            var globalSiteSpecificVars = {
                pathToJquery: '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-1.9.1.min'
                ,googleAnalyticsIdsArray: ['UA-52716039-2']//specify array of site specific id's NOT UCL generic UA-943297-1
            }
            if(cuttingTheMustard){
                globalSiteSpecificVars.pathToJquery = '//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/lib/jquery-2.1.1.min';
            }
        </script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">POST GRADUATE TAUGHT</h1>

<div>

<section class="content-box ma-logo">
  
<a class="image" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-ma" title="MA" target="_self"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/images/prospective-students/ma-logo" width="958" height="540" alt="MA" class="xxl-image" title="MA" /></a>

</section>



</div>



<div>

<section class="content-box ma-endorsement">
  


  <blockquote class="pull-quote__wrap clearfix">
    <span class="pull-quote__start">"</span>
    I have really enjoyed the freedom to explore both major and minor 
elements of the subjects covered by the taught courses. My primary 
interest in Old Masters has been developed by one of my taught courses 
and by my choice of dissertation topic was in turn influenced by a 
seemingly unrelated course on nineteenth-century technology. It is the 
predominant focus on the visual (and indeed sometimes not-visual) in 
conjunction with a strong theoretical framework that develops the 
students of the History of Art MA into strong well-rounded critical 
thinkers.
  </blockquote>
  




<h4 class="heading">  James Baskerville </h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                        History of Art MA
</p>


</section>



</div>




<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                <div id="content-footer"></div>

    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {

})();

<h3 class="heading">MORE INFORMATION</h3>

        <article class="block block--col-1">
            <h2 class="as-h5">UCL facilities</h2>
            <ul class="footer__list list-unstyled">
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/departments/faculties">Faculties and departments</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/library/">Library</a></li>
                <li class="footer__item"><a href="//www.ucl.ac.uk/museums">Museums and Collections</a></li>

            </ul>
        </article>

  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);

  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";

  doc.close();
})();

                    <div class="site-content__main">

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 



  <blockquote class="pull-quote__wrap clearfix">
    <span class="pull-quote__start">"</span>
    Studying
 since undergraduate on the joint course with SOAS, then again as 
postgraduate on the MA and now PhD, the History of Art Department at UCL
 has proved to be a consistently stimulating intellectual environment
for me. From attending the department's thriving extra curricular events
 program, to developing a strong relationship with my supervisors as 
well as other staff and colleagues, the sense of community is 
vital and engaging. Recent experience of teaching and
offering mentoring to MA students has further allowed me to acquire the 
skills necessary to a career in academia, but also encouraged me to 
reflect on research practice in new and exciting ways.

  </blockquote>
  




<h4 class="heading">  Tom Snow</h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                        Current PhD Student<br /></p>


<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

        <script>
(function(){
  if (window.BOOMR && window.BOOMR.version) { return; }
  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";
  where = document.getElementsByTagName("script")[0];
  where.parentNode.insertBefore(iframe, where);

  try {
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  } catch(e) {
    dom = document.domain;
    iframe.src="javascript:var d=document.open();d.domain='"+dom+"';void(0);";
    doc = iframe.contentWindow.document;
  }
  doc.open()._l = function() {
    var js = this.createElement("script");
    if (dom) { this.domain = dom; }
    js.id = "boomr-if-as";
    js.src = "//c.go-mpulse.net/boomerang/" +
    "SUWW2-HAKPB-Q4WN7-TQ6VL-GTMT2";
    BOOMR_lstart=new Date().getTime();
    this.body.appendChild(js);
  };
  doc.write('<body onload="document._l();">');
  doc.close();
})();
</script>

              href="//cdn.ucl.ac.uk/indigo/js/respond-x-domain/respond-proxy.html" />

                        <article class="article clearfix">
                            <!-- Start Silva content --> 
<h1 class="heading">PHD/MPHIL</h1>

<div>

<section class="content-box phd-logo">
  
<a class="image" href="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/prospective-students/hoa-phd-mphil" title="PhD" target="_self"><img src="http://www.ucl.ac.uk/art-history/images/prospective-students/phd-logo" width="958" height="540" alt="PHD" class="xxl-image" title="PhD" /></a>

</section>



</div>



<div>

<section class="content-box phd-endorsement">
  


  <blockquote class="pull-quote__wrap clearfix">
    <span class="pull-quote__start">"</span>
    Studying
 since undergraduate on the joint course with SOAS, then again as 
postgraduate on the MA and now PhD, the History of Art Department at UCL
 has proved to be a consistently stimulating intellectual environment
for me. From attending the department's thriving extra curricular events
 program, to developing a strong relationship with my supervisors as 
well as other staff and colleagues, the sense of community is 
vital and engaging. Recent experience of teaching and
offering mentoring to MA students has further allowed me to acquire the 
skills necessary to a career in academia, but also encouraged me to 
reflect on research practice in new and exciting ways.

  </blockquote>
  




<h4 class="heading">  Tom Snow</h4>



<p class="p"> 
                                                        Current PhD Student<br /></p>


</section>



</div>




<!-- End Silva content --> 

                        </article>

                    <div class="content-footer">
                                        <hr />
                <div id="content-footer"></div>

                    </div>

            </div>

  var dom,doc,where,iframe = document.createElement("iframe"),win = window;

  function boomerangSaveLoadTime(e) {
    win.BOOMR_onload=(e && e.timeStamp) || new Date().getTime();
  }
  if (win.addEventListener) {
    win.addEventListener("load", boomerangSaveLoadTime, false);
  } else if (win.attachEvent) {
    win.attachEvent("onload", boomerangSaveLoadTime);
  }

  iframe.src = "javascript:void(0)";
  iframe.title = ""; iframe.role = "presentation";
  (iframe.frameElement || iframe).style.cssText = "width:0;height:0;border:0;display:none;";

  doc.close();
})();
